metadata.title: USN-7080-1 -- Unbound vulnerability
metadata.description: Toshifumi Sakaguchi discovered that Unbound incorrectly handled name  compression for large RRsets, which could lead to excessive CPU usage.  An attacker could potentially use this issue to cause a denial of service by sending specially crafted DNS responses.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7080-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libunbound-dev - 1.6.7-1ubuntu2.6+esm3 libunbound2 - 1.6.7-1ubuntu2.6+esm3 python-unbound - 1.6.7-1ubuntu2.6+esm3 python3-unbound - 1.6.7-1ubuntu2.6+esm3 unbound - 1.6.7-1ubuntu2.6+esm3 unbound-anchor - 1.6.7-1ubuntu2.6+esm3 unbound-host - 1.6.7-1ubuntu2.6+esm3 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
